briefdescription.para: Number of bytes in a cache line.

detaileddescription.para: Must also be a multiple of the SIMD and SIMD4 register size, to preserve alignment.

briefdescription.para: Set up coordinate communication.
Round n up to the next multiple of f.
Return estimate of the load imbalance from the PME grid not being a good match for the number of PME ranks.

briefdescription.para: Initialize atom communication data structure.
Destroy an atom communication data structure and its child structs.

memberdef.argsstring: (pme_overlap_t *ol, int norder, int nnodes, int nodeid, int ndata, int commplainsize)
memberdef.name: init_overlap_comm

briefdescription.para: Initialize data structure for communication.
Destroy data structure for communication.
Return the smallest allowed PME grid size for pmeOrder.

memberdef.argsstring: (int pme_order, int nkx, int nky, int nkz, int nnodes_major, bool useThreads, bool errorsAreFatal)
memberdef.name: gmx_pme_check_restrictions

briefdescription.para: Check restrictions on pme_order and the PME grid nkx,nky,nkz.

detaileddescription.para: With errorsAreFatal=true, an exception or fatal error is generated on violation of restrictions. With errorsAreFatal=false, false is returned on violation of restrictions. When all restrictions are obeyed, true is returned. Argument useThreads tells if any MPI rank doing PME uses more than 1 threads. If at calling useThreads is unknown, pass true for conservative checking.
The PME GPU restrictions are checked separately during pme_gpu_init().

briefdescription.para: Round enumerator.

memberdef.argsstring: (const t_commrec *cr, int nnodes_major, int nnodes_minor, const t_inputrec *ir, int homenr, gmx_bool bFreeEnergy_q, gmx_bool bFreeEnergy_lj, gmx_bool bReproducible, real ewaldcoeff_q, real ewaldcoeff_lj, int nthread, PmeRunMode runMode, PmeGpu *pmeGpu, gmx_device_info_t *gpuInfo, const gmx::MDLogger &)
memberdef.name: gmx_pme_init

briefdescription.para: Construct PME data.

parameterdescription.para: if input grid sizes/PME order are inconsistent.

simplesect.para: Pointer to newly allocated and initialized PME data.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct gmx_pme_t **pmedata, t_commrec *cr, struct gmx_pme_t *pme_src, const t_inputrec *ir, const ivec grid_size, real ewaldcoeff_q, real ewaldcoeff_lj)
memberdef.name: gmx_pme_reinit

briefdescription.para: As gmx_pme_init, but takes most settings, except the grid/Ewald coefficients, from pme_src. This is only called when the PME cut-off/grid size changes.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct gmx_pme_t *pme, int n, rvec *x, real *q, real *V)
memberdef.name: gmx_pme_calc_energy

briefdescription.para: Calculate the PME grid energy V for n charges.

detaileddescription.para: The potential (found in pme) must have been found already with a call to gmx_pme_do() with at least GMX_PME_SPREAD and GMX_PME_SOLVE specified. Note that the charges are not spread on the grid in the pme struct. Currently does not work in parallel or with free energy.

briefdescription.para: Calculate initial Lorentz-Berthelot coefficients for LJ-PME.
Calculate next Lorentz-Berthelot coefficients for LJ-PME.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct gmx_pme_t *pme, int start, int homenr, rvec x[], rvec f[], real chargeA[], real chargeB[], real c6A[], real c6B[], real sigmaA[], real sigmaB[], matrix box, t_commrec *cr, int maxshift_x, int maxshift_y, t_nrnb *nrnb, gmx_wallcycle_t wcycle, matrix vir_q, matrix vir_lj, real *energy_q, real *energy_lj, real lambda_q, real lambda_lj, real *dvdlambda_q, real *dvdlambda_lj, int flags)
memberdef.name: gmx_pme_do

briefdescription.para: Do a PME calculation on a CPU for the long range electrostatics and/or LJ.

detaileddescription.para: The meaning of flags is defined above, and determines which parts of the calculation are performed.

simplesect.para: 0 indicates all well, non zero is an error code.

briefdescription.para: Destroys the PME data structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const gmx_pme_t *pme, const int nAtoms, const real *charges)
memberdef.name: gmx_pme_reinit_atoms

briefdescription.para: This function updates the local atom data on GPU after DD (charges, coordinates, etc.). TODO: it should update the PME CPU atom data as well. (currently PME CPU call gmx_pme_do() gets passed the input pointers for each computation).

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to the array of particle charges.

briefdescription.para: This file contains function definitions necessary for computing energies and forces for the PME long-ranged part (Coulomb and LJ).
